intro: Chirita mollissima, commonly known as the velvetleaf geranium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive texture. Chirita mollissima is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
